title: Bug 50059: Resources not served when metadatacomplete="true"
description:
Bug 50059: Resources are not served from /WEBINF/lib/{.jar}/METAINF/resources if metadatacomplete="true" is set in web.xml.

To reproduce the bug, follow these steps:

1. Make a Servlet 3.0 web app (let's name it foo) with metadatacomplete="true" attribute set on the webapp element in the /WEBIBNF/web.xml.

OB: Start the web app in Tomcat 7.0.2 and in the browser go to http://localhost:8080/foo/index.html.
Expected result: 200 response and index.html served.

EB: Actual result: 404 error is returned. The index.html file is not served.

SR: Modify the web.xml to have metadatacomplete="false" and restart the app. Then go to http://localhost:8080/foo/index.html. The expected result is a 200 response and index.html should be served.

Additional information: When the webapp's metadatacomplete attribute is set to true, the resources in the /METAINF/ directory of the .jar file located in /WEBINF/lib/ are not served. This behavior is different from Glassfish v3.0.1, where the resources are served regardless of the metadatacomplete attribute setting.
OB: Start the web app in Tomcat 7.0.2 and in the browser go to http://localhost:8080/foo/index.html. Expected result: 200 response and index.html served.
EB: Actual result: 404 error is returned. The index.html file is not served.
SR: Modify the web.xml to have metadatacomplete="false" and restart the app. Then go to http://localhost:8080/foo/index.html. The expected result is a 200 response and index.html should be served.
